H0.text: Gas is the state in which molecules of a substance are arranged in the most orderly way.

H1.text: Liquid is the state in which molecules of a substance are arranged in the most orderly way.

H2.text: Plasma is the state in which molecules of a substance are arranged in the most orderly way.

H3.text: Solid is the state in which molecules of a substance are arranged in the most orderly way.

A4.text: In contrast to solids, gases are very easily compressed as the molecules in a gas are far apart with few intermolecular interactions.

A5.text: Materials whose constituents are arranged in a regular pattern are known as crystals.
